body_html:
@spandantiwari I'd like to dig into the parameter sharing between modules.
PyTorch has always said "dont share parameters among modules, just reuse modules", such as:

y = my_rnn(inp_1)
z = my_rnn(inp_2)
(y+z).sum().backward()

Why are you sharing params between modules, do you find it more convenient or do you find it essential?

body:
@spandantiwari I'd like to dig into the parameter sharing between modules.
PyTorch has always said "dont share parameters among modules, just reuse modules", such as:
```
y = my_rnn(inp_1)
z = my_rnn(inp_2)
(y+z).sum().backward()
```

Why are you sharing params between modules, do you find it more convenient or do you find it essential?
